roleset.name: to make or become old or older, having grown older
roleset.note: AGE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls other_cos-45.4. (from age.01-v)
AGED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SHARP. (from aged.01-j)
AGING-N NOTES: Corresponds with age.01. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from aging.01-n)

example.name: age-v: intransitive
example.text: `` Oil of Olay brought with it the baggage of [*] being used [*-1]basically by older women who [*T*-2] had already aged , '' says [*T*-3] David Williams , a consultant with New England Consulting Group .

example.name: aged-j: with Arg2
example.text: In 1980 , the study says, prosecutors surveyed filed charges against 25 defendants for each 100,000 people-1 aged *trace*-1 18 years and older .

example.name: age-v: all args
example.text: Indulgent living has aged him beyond his thirty-eight years.

example.name: aging-n: Just Arg1
example.text: Marta's aging had not slowed her down as a roller derby athlete.

example.name: aging-n: With Arg0 (cause)
example.text: Cheesmaker Helena's careful aging of the cheddar allowed it to develop rich flavor.

role.descr: entity determining what the age cap is
thing arg1 is too old for

example.name: age_out-v: args 1, 2
example.text: Yeah , I was trying them for a little while , then I-1 ended up *-1 aging out the prime target market . You 've still got a few years in the lucrative age range .
